member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.GiantTortoise
member.summary: Special type of Tortoise to demonstrate large examples of recipes

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.GiantTortoise.DrawShape(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Creates a shape with a given number of sides, with a given color
--- Example : GiantTortoise.DrawShape(4,"red")
member.param: The number of sides for the shape
The color of the line for the shape

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.GiantTortoise.DrawSquare(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Creates a square with a given color
--- Example : GiantTortoise.DrawSquare("purple")
member.param: The color of the line for the shape

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.ColorWheel
member.summary: The color wheel allows you to set up up a color palette with multiple colors that you can use.

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ColorWheel.AddColor(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Adds a color to the available colors on the Color Wheel
--- Example : ColorWheel.AddColor("purple")
member.param: the color to add

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ColorWheel.GetNextColor
member.summary:
Shows the next color on the Color Wheel
--- Example :Tortise.SetPenColor(ColorWheel.GetNextColor())

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ColorWheel.GetRandomColor
member.summary:
Selects a random color from the colors on the Color Wheel. Useful for when you don't want your colors in any particular order.
--- Example :Tortise.SetPenColor(ColorWheel.GetRandomColor())
member.returns: One of the colors you've added

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ColorWheel.RemoveAllColors
member.summary:
Removes all colors from the Color Wheel. Allowing you to start over.
--- Example :ColorWheel.RemoveAllColors()

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise
member.summary: The Tortoise allows you to draw lines and shapes by moving it around on the canvas

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.SetPenColor(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Sets the color drawn by the Tortoise. See Also: Colors
--- Example :Tortoise.SetPenColor("red")
member.param: the color of the pen

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.GetPenColor
member.summary:
Gets color currently drawn by the Tortoise. The default is black.
--- Example : lastColor = Tortoise.GetPenColor()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.SetAngle(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Turns the Tortoise to face the given angle. 0 is Up, 180 is Down.
--- Example : Tortoise.SetAngle(45)

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.SetPenWidth(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Sets the width of the pen drawn by the Tortoise.
--- Example : Tortoise.SetPenWidth(2)
member.param: the width of the pen stroke

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.GetPenWidth
member.summary:
Gets the width of the pen current drawn by the Tortoise. The default is 2.
--- Example : penWidth = Tortoise.GetPenWidth()
member.returns: the width of the pen stroke in pixels

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.SetSpeed(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Sets the speed the Tortoise moves.
--- Example : Tortoise.SetSpeed(8)
member.param: The speed from 1 (slowest) to 10 (fastest)

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.Hide
member.summary:
Completely hides the tortoise, not just his head. Of course, if you move him, you'll still see his trail.
--- Example :Tortoise.Hide()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.Move(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Moves the Tortoise Forward the number of pixels specified.
--- Example : Tortoise.Move(50)
member.param: The number of pixels to move. Negative numbers will move the Tortoise backwards.

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.MoveTo(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Moves the Tortoise to the X,Y coordinate requested.
--- Example : Tortoise.MoveTo(0,0)
member.param: The X coordinate
The Y coordinate

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.Turn(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Turns the Tortoise to the right (clockwise) the degrees specified.
--- Example : Tortoise.Turn(90)
member.param: The degrees to turn. Negative numbers will move the Tortoise to the left (counter-clockwise)

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.GetX
member.summary:
Gets the X location of the Tortoise. The default is 320.
--- Example :x = Tortoise.GetX()
member.returns: The X location of the Tortoise

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.SetX(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Sets the X location of the Tortoise The Tortoise instantly moves there, without drawing a line
--- Example :Tortoise.SetX(10)
member.param: The X location

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.SetY(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Sets the Y location of the Tortoise The Tortoise instantly moves there, without drawing a line
--- Example :Tortoise.SetY(10)
member.param: The Y location

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.GetY
member.summary:
Gets the Y location of the Tortoise. The default is 240.
--- Example :y = Tortoise.GetY()
member.returns: The y location of the Tortoise

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.GetAngle
member.summary:
Gets Angle the Tortoise is Point. Up is 0 dergrees. The default is 0 (aiming up).
--- Example :angle = Tortoise.GetAngle()
member.returns: The Angle the Tortoise is Facing

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.GetSpeed
member.summary:
Gets the current speed of the Tortoise. The default is 5.
--- Example :speed = Tortoise.GetSpeed()
member.returns: The current speed of the Tortoise

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.PenUp
member.summary:
When the pen is up, the tortoise does not leave a trail.
--- Example :Tortoise.PenUp()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Tortoise.PenDown
member.summary:
When the pen is down, the tortoise leaves a trail.
--- Example :Tortoise.PenDown()

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.MessageBox
member.summary: This creates a pop up box that you can use to ask for information or tell people stuff.

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.MessageBox.AskForInput(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Prompts the user to enter some text
--- Example : name = MessageBox.AskForInput("what is your name?")
member.param: the question you want the user to answer

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.MessageBox.ShowMessage(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary: Display a message to your end user --- Example : MessageBox.ShowMessage("girl programmers rule!")
member.param: the message you want to display

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.Colors
member.summary: Every color under the rainbow, and different ways to get them.

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Colors.GetRandomColor
member.summary:
Picks a color at Random
--- Example : Tortise.SetPenColor(Colors.GetRandomColor())

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Colors.Darken(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Makes a color gradually darker
--- Example : darkenedColor = Colors.Darken("red")
member.param: The color you want a darker shade of
member.returns: The Darker version of the color passed in

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Colors.Lighten(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Makes a color gradually lighter
--- Example : lightenedColor = Colors.Lighten("green")
member.param: The color you want a lighter shade of
member.returns: The Lighter version of the color passed in

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.TicTacToe.PlayPiece(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Places a piece on a square (1-9). Which one is best? That's up to you.
--- Example :TicTacToe.PlayPiece(5)
member.param: Which Square to Play in (1-9)

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.TicTacToe.GetSquareByXY(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Is [2,3] square #8 or #6? Too hard to find out? Not to worry, this method will do the math for you!
--- Example :square = TicTacToe.GetSquareByXY(2,3)
member.param: The X location (1-3)
The Y location (1-3)

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.TicTacToe.IsEmpty(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
You can't play in a square that's already taken, so it's good to ask first. This will tell you if it's too late.
--- Example :taken = TicTacToe.IsEmpty(3)
member.param: The Square (1-9) you want to know about
member.returns: true if empty, false if not

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.TicTacToe.Start
member.summary:
Get ready! Get Set! Go! Time to start the game, may the program win!
--- Example :TicTacToe.Start()

member.name: E:SmallBasicFun.TicTacToe.TurnForPlayerX
member.summary:
Sets the subroutine to be called when it's Player X's turn. Player X always goes first
--- Example :TicTacToe.TurnForPlayerX = yourComputerPlayer

member.name: E:SmallBasicFun.TicTacToe.TurnForPlayerO
member.summary:
Sets the subroutine to be called when it's Player O's turn. Player O always goes second
--- Example :TicTacToe.TurnForPlayerO = yourComputerPlayer

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.WindowManager.Add(System.Windows.Window)
member.summary: Adds Windows to a collection in the context of the currently running program
member.param: Window to be tracked for life of current program execution
member.exception: Throw when window argument is null

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker
member.summary: Big Shapes, Small Shapes, Circles, Squares from tiny Triangles to dazzling Diamonds You want them, we've got them! Don't settle for boring shapeless programs, add some of our spectacular shapes to your programs today!

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker.CreateCircle(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Creates a circle that you can place on the ProgramWindow
--- Example : circle = ShapeMaker.CreateCircle(20)
member.param: The radius of the circle in pixels

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker.CreateRectangle(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Creates a rectangle that you can place on the ProgramWindow
--- Example : box = ShapeMaker.CreateRectangle(30,40)
member.param: The width of the rectangle in pixels
The height of the rectangle in pixels

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker.RestoreDefaults
member.summary:
Restores the default colors and thickness
--- Example : ShapeMaker.RestoreDefaults()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker.SetOpacity(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Changes the levels of opacity on a shape. 100% Opacity is a completely solid shape. 0% Opacity is a completely transparent shape.
--- Example :ShapeMaker.SetOpacity(ShapeMaker.CreateCircle(20), 42)
member.param: The shape you want to alter
The percentage of opacity desired (0-100)

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker.SetColorForNextShape(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Sets the Color for the inside of the next shape you create.
--- Example :ShapeMaker.SetColorForNextShape("green")
member.param: The Color of the next shape

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker.SetOutlineColorForNextShape(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Sets the Color for the outside line of the next shape you create.
--- Example :ShapeMaker.SetOutlineColorForNextShape("purple")
member.param: The Color of outline of the next shape

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker.RemoveShape(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Removes a shape from the Program Window
--- Example :ShapeMaker.RemoveShape(circle)
member.param: The shape you want to remove

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ShapeMaker.CenterShapeAt(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Centers a shape at a given location
--- Example :ShapeMaker.CenterShapeAt(ShapeMaker.CreateCircle(20), 20, 20)
member.param: The shape you want centered
The X coordinate of the center
The Y coordinate of the center

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.CurrentFont
member.summary: BIG FONTS, small fonts, cRaZy FoNts. Don't call ProgramWindow.DrawText() with just some boring, default Font. Add your personal font favorites here

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.CurrentFont.SetSize(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
This sets how big the Font is. The default font size is 12, but you can use anything from 1-100 but please don't use size 37, it's a scary size.
--- Example : CurrentFont.SetSize(42)
member.param: The size of the font

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.CurrentFont.SetColor(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
This sets the color of the Font. The default font color is blue. Ask the Colors object which colors you can use.
--- Example : CurrentFont.SetColor(Colors.PeachPuff)
member.param: The color of the font

members.member: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.Timer
member.summary: Need something to happen every hour, on the hour? Then Timer is the thing for you! Act now - time is running out!

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Timer.Start(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Nothin's gonna' happen, 'till you call this one
--- Example :Timer.Start(1000)
member.param: number of milliseconds between each Tick

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Timer.Stop
member.summary:
Hammer Time! This will stop what you started
--- Example :Timer.Stop()

member.name: E:SmallBasicFun.Timer.Tick
member.summary:
Invokes your subroutine every time the Timer ticks
--- Example : Timer.Tick = Tock Sub Tock EndSub

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.Viewer
member.summary: Tools to help you display all types of files

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Viewer.DisplayRtfFile(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Display Rich Text Files (rtf). These are generally made in wordpad.
The contents of the rtf file. This will be saved to a temporary file and then opened --- Example : words["name"] = "Charlie Brown" rtfContents = Parser.MergeRtfFile("c:\myTemplate.rft", words) Viewer.DisplayRtfFile(rtfContents)
member.returns: The name of the temporary rtf file created.

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.Parser
member.summary: This will help you {insert words} into your phrases, text and {other words}

members.member:
Merges a template with a list of words. The words to be merged need to be wrapped in {currly braces}
The template: "this is a {adjective} template" The wordList: wordList["simple"] The result of merging the template with the word list --- Example :wordList["adjective"] = "smelly" wordList["bodyPart"] = "butt" output = Parser.Merge("You have a {adjective} {bodyPart}!", wordList)

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.Parser.MergeRtfFile(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
The merges a template in the form of a Rich Text File (rtf), usually created using WordPad. It gives you back the rtf text, which you can display using the Viewer
the name of the rtf file (needs the full path) The wordList: wordList["simple"] --- Example : words["name"] = "Charlie Brown" rtfContents = Parser.MergeRtfFile("c:\myTemplate.rft", words) Viewer.DisplayRtfFile(rtfContents)

member.name: T:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow
member.summary: This is the main window of your program. This is where the turtle, lines, shapes and images will appear.

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.DrawBackgroundImage(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Draws an image, resized to the current dimensions of the window
--- Example : ProgramWindow.DrawBackgroundImage(Flickr.GetPictureOfMoment())
member.param: The image to be drawn

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.Clear
member.summary:
Wipes the window clean.
--- Example : ProgramWindow.Clear()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.DrawText(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Draws some words on the Program Window using the settings from CurrentFont (size, etc...)
--- Example : ProgramWindow.DrawText("Small Basic Rocks",0,0)
member.param: The words you want to write
The X coordinate of top left corner of the words
The Y coordinate of top left corner of the words

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.GetMouseX
member.summary:
Gets the location of the Mouse relative to the Top Left of the Program Window.
--- Example :x = ProgramWindow.GetMouseX()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.GetMouseY
member.summary:
Gets the location of the Mouse relative to the Top Left of the Program Window.
--- Example :y = ProgramWindow.GetMouseY()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.SetBackgroundColor(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Changes the background of the Program Window to the color of your choice.
--- Example :ProgramWindow.SetBackgroundColor("Red")
member.param: The color you want the background to be.

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.GetPixelColor(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive,Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Retrieves the current color of the pixel at the (x,y) location.
--- Example :color = ProgramWindow.GetPixelColor(48, 34)
member.param: The X coordinate of the pixel
The Y coordinate of the pixel

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.GetWindowWidth
member.summary:
Gets the current width of the Window in pixels
--- Example :w = ProgramWindow.GetWindowWidth()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.GetWindowHeight
member.summary:
Gets the current height of the Window in pixels
--- Example :w = ProgramWindow.GetWindowHeight()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.TakeScreenShot
member.summary:
Prints a picture of the current Program Window. The file name is defined by the proctor.txt file in your lib directory.
--- Example :ProgramWindow.TakeScreenShot()

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.DisplayScreenShotLocation
member.summary: Opens a MessageBox and calls ShowMessage with the location of the FileName and ScreenShot location path

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.ConcatentateDisplayScreenShotLocation
member.summary: Outputs the location of the FileName and ScreenShot location path

member.name: M:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.SetTextColor(Microsoft.SmallBasic.Library.Primitive)
member.summary:
Changes the color the Text is written in.
--- Example :ProgramWindow.SetTextColor(Colors.Tomato)

member.name: E:SmallBasicFun.ProgramWindow.MouseClicked
member.summary:
Invoke your subroutine each time the mouse is clicked
--- Example : ProgramWindow.MouseClicked = Cheese Sub Cheese EndSub
